title: Drawing, 1770–78
medium: Black chalk, brush and gray watercolor on laid cream paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Brookline, MA; 1938: acquired by Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The buildings of the monastery are in the middle ground upon a terrace of a hill sloping down to the foreground. There is a wall with the gateway, where a guard and a group of monks stand. Monks and soldiers are on the road connecting the gateways, outer and inner, in front of the church. Once of the soldiers busies himself to chase to fighting dogs. A coach drawn by four horses, preceded by a courier, approaches from right. A family sits inside. Another coach with two horses follows. At left are groups of people. Trees flank the scene.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, 1770–78. Black chalk, brush and gray watercolor on laid cream paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-488.
